alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; West Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 1:39PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EAST CENTRAL CIBOLA AND NORTHWESTERN VALENCIA COUNTIES THROUGH 215 PM MDT... At 139 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 15 miles southeast of Mesita, or 19 miles southeast of Laguna Pueblo. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Cibola and northwestern Valencia Counties. This includes Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 128 and 130. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Heavy rains will cause water to pond on roads and in low spots. Fast running water will quickly fill arroyos and ditches.

area.areaDesc: Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; West Central Highlands
